Name: Minimum average fuel economy of light-duty vehicles purchased by the city.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to minimum average fuel economy of light-duty vehicles purchased by the city.

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

History.Action: P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab Section 1. Paragraph 2 of subdivision d of section 24-163.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 130 for the year 2005, is amended to read as follows: \ul\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\tab (2) The city shall achieve the following minimum percentage increases in the average fuel economy of all light-duty vehicles purchased by the city during the following fiscal years, relative to the average fuel economy of all such vehicles purchased by the city during the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2004, calculated pursuant to paragraph one of this subdivision:\par
\tab (i) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2006, five percent;\par
\tab (ii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2007, eight percent;\par
\tab (iii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2008, ten percent; \par
\tab (iv) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2009, twelve percent; \par
\tab (v) For the fiscal [year] \ul years\ulnone  beginning July 1, 2010 and July 1, 2011, fifteen percent;\par
\tab (vi) For the fiscal [year] \ul years\ulnone  beginning July 1, 2012, July 1, 2013 and July 1, 2014, eighteen percent; [and]\par
\tab (vii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2015, [and for each fiscal year thereafter,] twenty percent[.]\ul ;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (viii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2016, twenty percent;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (ix) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2017, twenty-five percent;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (x) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2018, twenty-five percent;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (xi) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2019, thirty-percent;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (xii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2020, thirty-percent;\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (xiii) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2021, thirty-five percent; and\ulnone\par
\tab\ul (xiv) For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2022, and for each fiscal year thereafter, forty percent.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf1\tab\'a7 2. This local law shall take effect immediately.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\cf0 LS 4816\par
